intro: Gilia heterostyla, commonly known as the two-styled gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a white throat. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces two distinct styles in its flowers, which is a notable botanical feature. Gilia heterostyla is part of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
